LFS Variable Codebook (cross-sectional)

codebook.Rmd

List of Variables

This document details the cleaned variables derived from the cross-sectional quarterly Labour Force Survey datasets using the lfsclean package, grouped by cleaning function.

Demographic variables

Demographic variables produced by the lfs_clean_demographic function.

  • d_age (numeric)

  • d_sex (factor):

    • “male”
    • “female”

  • d_ethnicity_4cat (factor):

    • “white”
    • “mixed”
    • “black”
    • “asian_other”

  • d_ethnicity_2cat (factor):

    • “white”
    • “non_white”

  • d_region (factor):

    • “north_east”
    • “north_west”
    • “yorks_and_humber”
    • “east_midlands”
    • “west_midlands”
    • “east_of_england”
    • “london”
    • “south_east”
    • “south_west”
    • “wales”
    • “scotland”
    • “northern_ireland”

  • d_country (factor):

    • “england”
    • “scotland”
    • “wales”
    • “northern_ireland”

  • d_marstat (factor):

    • “single”
    • “married”
    • “sep_div_wid”

Economic activity

Variables cleaned by the lfs_clean_economic_activity function - economic status and job characteristics for those in work.

  • l_lmstatus_2cat (factor):
    • “employed”
    • “non_employed”
  • l_lmstatus_3cat (factor):
    • “employed”
    • “unemployed”
    • “inactive”
  • l_lmstatus_8cat (factor):
    • “employed”
    • “self_employed”
    • “retired”
    • “unemployed”
    • “sick”
    • “caring”
    • “education”
    • “other”

Education

Qualification variables cleaned by the lfs_clean_education function.

  • q_highest_qual (factor):
    • “Degree”
    • “Level 4+ Vocational”
    • “Level 3”
    • “Level 2”
    • “Below Level 2/Other”
    • “No qualifications”
  • q_edage (numeric):

Earnings and hours

For those in work, variables on hours worked (and would like to work) and earnings cleaned by the lfs_clean_hours_earn function.

  • eh_awage Real hourly earnings in March 2020 prices, based on actual hours worked in the reference week (Numeric).

  • eh_uwage Real hourly earnings in March 2020 prices, based on usual hours worked (Numeric).

  • eh_weekly_earnings Gross real weekly earnings in March 2020 prices in the reference week (Numeric).

  • eh_awage_nom Nominal hourly earnings, based on actual hours worked in the reference week (Numeric).

  • eh_uwage_nom Nominal hourly earnings, based on usual hours worked (Numeric).

  • eh_weekly_earnings_nom Gross nominal weekly earnings in the reference week (Numeric).

  • eh_ahours Hours worked in the reference week (Numeric).

  • eh_uhours Hours usually worked in a week (Numeric).

  • eh_undemp Would like to work more hours? (Factor)

    • “yes”
    • “no”

  • eh_ovemp Would like to work fewer hours? (Factor)

    • “yes”
    • “no”

  • eh_ovhrs Number of horus fewer would like to work (Numeric)

  • eh_undhrs Number of hours more would like to work (Numeric)
